name: Unable to See Replies to Secure Emails
title: Unable to See Replies to Secure Emails
body:
Sometimes, users may reply to a secure email notification rather than the secure email itself. In this case, when the reply is opened within Microsoft Outlook, it will automatically decrypt the .switch file, which hides the reply behind it.

If you select the X icon in the right-hand corner of the secure email, as shown below, then it should display the unencrypted reply.

images.alt:
This image depicts a horizontal User Interface (UI) control strip containing five segregated interactive elements, typically used for state management, navigation history, and closure.

**Toolbar Structure:** A single-row toolbar composed of five button cells with thin gray vertical separators.

**Elements (Left to Right):**

1.  **Lock/State Toggle Button (Active):** Displayed within a cell highlighted by a reddish-brown outline, indicating a selected or active state. The icon is an outline of an **open padlock** (U+1F513), colored reddish-brown.
2.  **Undo Button:** Contains a **curved arrow pointing left** (Undo icon), colored purple/magenta.
3.  **Step Back/Previous Button:** Contains a **curved arrow pointing left preceded by a double chevron** (Step Back or Bulk Undo icon), colored purple/magenta.
4.  **Redo Button (Disabled):** Contains a **right-pointing arrow** (Redo icon), colored light blue/cyan and appearing faded, indicating a currently disabled or inactive state.
5.  **Close/Cancel Button:** Contains a standard **'X' symbol** (Close or Exit icon), colored dark gray/black.
images.context: hand corner of the secure email, as shown below, then it should display the unencrypted reply.
